channel.title: Java Editor anyone?
channel.description: Does anybody know of something like an html editor that works for runescape private servers? Instead of editing the code, just dragging in objects and NPCs. Cause if there was one of those existed that would be sweet. If they're not real, then someone should make one for RSPS's.

item.title: Java Editor anyone?
item.dc:creator: @Sun_Chips Sun Chips
item.description:
@Sun_Chips wrote:

No this isn’t rpg maker.

Read full topic

wysiwyg rsps. god help us.

item.title: Java Editor anyone?
item.dc:creator: @blood_beast blood beast
item.description:
@blood_beast wrote:

Yes we know, but there is no way you could make everything drag and drop. So I'm asking what you want to be drag and drop...
I guess as much as you [i]could[/i] make drag and drop [i]should[/i] be made drag and drop.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Editor anyone?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:19, topic:393290”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=490460.msg3587127#msg3587127 date=1304274947]

It would be pretty challenging, but possible… Iirc there is already a drag and drop interface editor. Quite honestly, you could probably hack the client up quite a bit to turn it into an object, npc, and item spawner (generates the codes for you).

The idea I am having right now, is limited, but would work for a ALPHA version. Using the world-map image from Google or something, create a tile-based overlay using the world-map as the background. Simply choose the NPC of your choice (editable via CFG file [id and name only] to be able to add your own etc), drag it onto the map. The coordinates appear onto a simple textbox, simply change the values if you need a more precise spot. (Anchor point at the top-left corner for the X/Y coord)
[/quote]That’s probably the simplest possible drag and drop tool we could create[/quote]
I know it would be simple, and it would narrow down questions alot, and make adding NPC’s to an area alot easier as well.

[quote=“Davidi2, post:19, topic:393290”][quote author=blood beast link=topic=490460.msg3587019#msg3587019 date=1304269779]

it has drag/drop technology for creating a webpage

That’s exactly what I am looking for!
[/quote]Yes we know, but there is no way you could make everything drag and drop. So I’m asking what you want to be drag and drop… some of it is possible, most of it would not be possible[/quote]
Then why not make what is possible, and leave the rest alone lol.

Read full topic

It would be pretty challenging, but possible… Iirc there is already a drag and drop interface editor. Quite honestly, you could probably hack the client up quite a bit to turn it into an object, npc, and item spawner (generates the codes for you).
[/quote]
The idea I am having right now, is limited, but would work for a ALPHA version. Using the world-map image from Google or something, create a tile-based overlay using the world-map as the background. Simply choose the NPC of your choice (editable via CFG file [id and name only] to be able to add your own etc), drag it onto the map. The coordinates appear onto a simple textbox, simply change the values if you need a more precise spot. (Anchor point at the top-left corner for the X/Y coord)[/quote]That’s probably the simplest possible drag and drop tool we could create

[quote=“blood beast, post:16, topic:393290”]

it has drag/drop technology for creating a webpage

That’s exactly what I am looking for![/quote]Yes we know, but there is no way you could make everything drag and drop. So I’m asking what you want to be drag and drop… some of it is possible, most of it would not be possible

Read full topic

m.dog311:

It would be pretty challenging, but possible… Iirc there is already a drag and drop interface editor. Quite honestly, you could probably hack the client up quite a bit to turn it into an object, npc, and item spawner (generates the codes for you).

The idea I am having right now, is limited, but would work for a ALPHA version. Using the world-map image from Google or something, create a tile-based overlay using the world-map as the background. Simply choose the NPC of your choice (editable via CFG file [id and name only] to be able to add your own etc), drag it onto the map. The coordinates appear onto a simple textbox, simply change the values if you need a more precise spot. (Anchor point at the top-left corner for the X/Y coord)

item.title: Java Editor anyone?
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:14, topic:393290”][quote author=B2300 T4nk link=topic=490460.msg3586715#msg3586715 date=1304233462]
What does HTML have to do with RSPS.
[/quote]
If you have ever looked at DreamWeaver, it has drag/drop technology for creating a webpage. OP was simply requesting/wanting to know of a program that had the same editing ability, but for a RSPS.[/quote]He couldve said Java >.< DreamWeaver is useful but you need to be pro and understand how to use it.

Read full topic
